data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you always face forward, you can go forward or backward. If you always face down, you can go backward. So, the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
For the instructions to turn around and turn right, it must be the same as to take 4 steps and turn around. Thus, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
When you try to return the other way around you need to take all 8 steps to get back to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You can repeat these steps two ways: Take 1 step and Take 7 Steps. If you turn left after taking 7 Steps, you return to the starting point after taking 1 step. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn left. Turn left. Take 9 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 3 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you start from the starting point, you take 5 steps to the starting point. So, the answer is Yeah.

Turning around and turning around at an angle are similar. So, the answer is Yes.

As long as you turn around, you can return to the starting point in six steps. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step left. Take 4 steps forward. Take 6 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

It makes more sense to always face forward. Since one takes 1 step left, you go forward. Since you take 4 steps forward, you go backwards. In order to return to your starting point, you must begin from the same point. So, the answer is Yes.

The starting point has a number in it that is 9 steps. The correct way to return to start is take 3 steps. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 3 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
A person who always faces forward never takes any step backwards. So, the answer is No.

Backwards moves must always be facing forward. To return to the starting point, you would take 6 steps backwards. So, the answer is Yes.

You always face forward. You can continue to face forward. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 4 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 1 step right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
A person that always faces forward travels forward with their feet shoulder to shoulder. The direction of travel could be found on the back of a map or posted on the internet. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 3 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 1 step forward. Take 3 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

When facing forward, keep your feet flat on the ground and start out with your right foot facing forward. Take 6 steps in each direction. If looking to the right, take three steps right. When your right foot is facing forward take 5 steps backwards. When looking to the left, take three steps right. When looking to the right, take six steps left. If looking to the right then take one step forward. When looking to the right then take three steps right. So, the answer is Yes.

The starting point is at the place where the first turn was. So, the answer is Yes.

The instructions are never repeated. If you take 10 steps backward, you go to the starting point. So, the answer is No.

After you take 7 steps backward, you always have to face forward. To return to the starting point, you make 4 turns at the same time. Thus, the answer is Yes.

If you take 5 steps left and bring yourself back to the starting point, you are done. If you take 4 steps right and bring yourself back to the starting point again, you are still back. Thus, the answer is Yes.

In the first step, take 2 steps backward. In the second step, take 4 steps backward. In the third step, take 6 steps forward. Even though you always face forward, the second step takes 6 steps forward which is to the right of your first step. So, the answer is Yes.

Each step begins at a different point than the previous step. After you have taken 7 steps left, you have taken 8 steps right. You have taken 10 steps backward, and taken 4 steps left. So, the answer is yes.

Take 9 steps forward. Take 5 steps right. Take 1 step forward. Take 3 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

One of the last instructions is "If you always face forward, " and the first instruction is not "We always face forward. The second instruction is basically "We always face forward. If you are facing the wrong direction, go 8 steps left. If you are facing the right direction, go 8 steps left. If you are facing the left direction, go 5 steps left. If you are facing the right direction, go 5 steps right. If you are facing the left direction, go 5 steps right. If you are facing the right direction, go 5 steps right. The first instruction is to always face left. Thus, the answer is Yes.

Every step, no matter how many, you take the same direction that you started from. If you begin at 6 steps right and leave, you will take 6 steps right and you would return to the starting point with s 8 steps left and t 2 steps forward. Thus, the answer is yes.
